page.title: 06Arkley Windmill
page.content: The windmill was built c.1806 by a Mr. Whitehead when corn prices were high due to the Napoleonic Wars. It was used until about 1917. In 1929 it was auctioned to Mr. Booth who made many alterations. A pair of sails were hung, the cap rebuilt, etc. Mr. and Mrs. W. Saunders bought the mill in 1958 and the missing sails were replaced. They are 28 feet long and 6 feet wide. The machinery is still intact and the sails are turned every quarter day to prevent water collecting and rotting them. The last miller to grind corn in Arkley was Noah Edwards. Some people who were in Arkley in 1961 remembered going to the mill house for flour and the miller going to Mill Hill with pony and van to sell his wares.
